meanings.definition: To make or become less intelligent or knowledgeable.
meanings.sent1: Watching too much TV can be dumbing for your brain.
meanings.sent2: The educational system should focus on teaching, not dumbing students down.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show had a skit about dumbing down a genius to fit in with regular folks.
meanings.sent4: The constant exposure to misinformation is slowly dumbing society.
meanings.sent5: The lack of critical thinking skills is dumbing down the population.

meanings.definition: The act of making something simpler or easier to understand.
meanings.sent1: The dumbing of the instructions helped everyone follow along.
meanings.sent2: The dumbing of the legal jargon made the contract more accessible.
meanings.sent3: The dumbing of the recipe made it foolproof for even the worst cooks.
meanings.sent4: The dumbing of the technology allowed even children to use it effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The dumbing of the concept made it clear to even the most confused minds.
